page.title: 09Dairy Farming Around Chard
page.content: { {Dairy}farming predominates with Friesian{cows}being kept on the open fields in summer and in covered cubicle_yards during the winter. {Grass}is often rationed by strip grazing using an electric fence which is moved across the field daily to expose fresh food,or in hill areas by open grazing particular fields. In winter stock are fed{silage} augmented with brewers' grains,sugar beet pulp,maize or other bulky foods. {Cows}are milked morning & evening. The milk is stored in a refrigerated bulk tank for daily collection by tankers from the Milk Marketing Board creamery at Chard Junction. Here most milk is made into{butter}&{cream}with the remainder dehydrated for storage by{EEC.}or use in confectionery etc.
